intro: Erythrococca pallidifolia, commonly known as the pale-leaved erythrococca, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, pale green leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Erythrococca pallidifolia is often found in shaded, moist environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
